original_text:
John Hunter Tomb of the Scarab Queen
Informazioni generali
Software: Pragmatic Play
Rulli: 5
Linee di gioco: 25
Importo minimo della puntata: 0,25 €
Importo massimo della puntata: 125 €
Vincita massima: x10.500 volte la puntata
Return to Player (RTP): 96,5%
Volatilità: media
Caratteristiche principali
John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen è il lunghissimo titolo della terza slot dello sviluppatore Pragmatic Play, che racconta le vicissitudini dell’avido esploratore John Hunter mentre gira il mondo cercando di appropriarsi di ricchezze e tesori vari.
La figura dell’esploratore alla ricerca dei tesori non è una novità: prima della Pragmatic ci hanno pensato la Play’n Go con la figura di Rich Wilde e la Novomatic con la serie del Libro dei Morti.
Con la prima uscita della saga di John Hunter, chiamata Da Vinci’s Treasure, la Pragmatic suscitò abbastanza clamore pubblicizzando una vincita stratosferica pari a 48.000 volte la puntata, vincita a cui mai nessuno, ovviamente, è mai andato neanche vicino! Polemiche anche per la seconda slot della serie, Aztec Treasure, quando fu rivelato che la slot in realtà non era del tutto originale ma si trattava di una sorta di mix tra il classico della Interactive Montezuma’s Treasure e una sorta di prototipo fatto in casa sul motore Megaways.
Per quanto riguarda quest’ultimo capitolo della serie, l’esploratore John Hunter si trova niente meno che tra le piramidi di Giza: il gioco prevede 5 rulli e 25 linee di pagamento ed è arricchito dalla possibilità di ottenere svariati giri gratuiti e dei moltiplicatori fino a x25.
Simboli, Wild e Scatter
Lo sfondo di John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen è un ambiente desertico con le grandi piramidi che fiancheggiano i rulli e anche i simboli con maggior valore sono a tema Antico Egitto come il book of ra slot. Tra questi troviamo, per quanto riguarda i simboli regolari, una borsa in cuoio, una pistola nella fondina, l’esploratore John Hunter e la divinità Anobi. La regina Cleopatra è il Wild di questa slot machine e può sostituire tutti gli altri simboli, tranne lo Scatter, per ottenere una combinazione vincente. Lo Scatter è rappresentato invece dalla maestosa piramide e permette di accedere ai giri gratuiti, in cui si potrà approfittare anche di vari moltiplicatori.
Oltre si simboli tematici, troviamo le lettere che si riferiscono alle carte da gioco, in questo caso solo dal J all’Asso.
John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen: conclusioni
Delle tre slot machine della saga dell’esploratore Hunter, questa è la meglio riuscita: è innanzitutto una slot originale, il montepremi è alto ma non del tutto improbabile come quello del primo capitolo della serie, inoltre il gameplay lineare è arricchito con delle funzionalità speciali che rendono il gioco abbastanza divertente.
Si può giocare a John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen sia da computer desktop sia da dispositivi mobili in diversi casinò online, scommettendo a partire da 0,20 € fino a 125 € a giro.
La colonna sonora di ispirazione egiziana e la grafica ben curata, infine, vi faranno vivere un’esperienza di gioco gradevole!

raw_translation.response:
John Hunter Tomb of the Scarab Queen
General information
Software: Pragmatic Play
Reels: 5
Paylines: 25
Minimum bet amount: €0.25
Maximum bet amount: €125
Maximum payout: x10,500 times the bet
Return to Player (RTP): 96.5%
Volatility: medium
Key features
John Hunter and the Scarab Queen's Tomb is the lengthy title of the third slot game by developer Pragmatic Play, which tells the story of the greedy explorer John Hunter as he travels the world in search of riches and treasures. The figure of the treasure-seeking explorer is not a new one: before Pragmatic, Play’n Go had Rich Wilde, and Novomatic had The Book of the Dead series. 
With the first release of the John Hunter saga, called Da Vinci’s Treasure, Pragmatic caused quite a stir by advertising a sky-high payout of 48,000 times the bet, a win that no one, of course, has ever come close to! There were also controversies over the second slot in the series, Aztec Treasure, when it was revealed that the slot was not entirely original, but rather a sort of mix between the classic Interactive Montezuma’s Treasure and a sort of homemade prototype on the Megaways engine. 
As for this latest chapter in the series, the explorer John Hunter finds himself no less than among the pyramids of Giza: the game features 5 reels and 25 paylines and is enriched by the possibility of obtaining various free spins and multipliers up to x25.
Symbols, Wild and Scatter
The background of John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen is a desert environment with the great pyramids flanking the reels, and even the high-value symbols are themed around Ancient Egypt like the Book of Ra slot. Among these are, as far as regular symbols are concerned, a leather bag, a gun in a holster, the explorer John Hunter, and the deity Anobi. Queen Cleopatra is the Wild in this slot machine and can substitute for all other symbols except the Scatter to achieve a winning combination. The Scatter is instead represented by the majestic pyramid and allows access to free spins, where various multipliers can also be taken advantage of.
In addition to the thematic symbols, we find the letters referring to the playing cards, in this case only from J to Ace.
John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen: conclusions
Of the three slot machines in the Hunter saga, this is the most successful: it is above all an original slot, the jackpot is high but not entirely unlikely like that of the first chapter of the series, and the linear gameplay is enriched with special features that make it quite fun. 
John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen can be played on both desktop computers and mobile devices in different online casinos, with bets ranging from €0.20 up to €125 per spin. 
Finally, the Egyptian-inspired soundtrack and well-crafted graphics will give you a pleasant gaming experience!

Review: John Hunter Tomb of the Scarab Queen
General information
Software: Pragmatic Play
Reels: 5
Paylines: 25
Minimum bet amount: €0.25
Maximum bet amount: €125
Maximum win: x10,500 times the bet
Return to Player (RTP): 96.5%
Volatility: medium
Main features
John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen is the title of the third slot from developer Pragmatic Play, which tells the story of the greedy explorer John Hunter as he travels the world seeking to appropriate riches and various treasures.
The figure of the treasure-seeking explorer is not new: before Pragmatic, Play'n Go created the character of Rich Wilde, and Novomatic created the Book of Dead series.
With the first release of the John Hunter saga, called Da Vinci's Treasure, Pragmatic Play caused a stir by advertising a stratospheric win equal to 48,000 times the bet, a win that no one, of course, ever came close to! There were also controversies over the second slot in the series, Aztec Treasure, when it was revealed that the slot was not entirely original but was a kind of mix between the classic Interactive Montezuma's Treasure and a kind of homemade prototype on the Megaways engine.
As for this latest chapter in the series, explorer John Hunter finds himself no less than among the pyramids of Giza: the game features 5 reels and 25 paylines and is enriched by the possibility of obtaining various free spins and multipliers up to x25.
Symbols, Wilds and Scatters
The background of John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen is a desert environment with the great pyramids flanking the reels, and even the symbols with the highest value are themed to Ancient Egypt like the Book of Ra slot. Among these, as far as regular symbols are concerned, we find a leather bag, a gun in a holster, the explorer John Hunter, and the deity Anobi. Queen Cleopatra is the Wild of this slot machine and can replace all other symbols, except the Scatter, to achieve a winning combination. The Scatter is instead represented by the majestic pyramid and allows access to free spins, where you can also take advantage of various multipliers.
In addition to the themed symbols, we also find the cards from the J to the Ace.
John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen: conclusions
Of the three slot machines in the Hunter explorer saga, this is the most successful: it is first and foremost an original slot, the jackpot is high but not entirely improbable like that of the first chapter in the series, and the linear gameplay is enriched with special features that make the game quite enjoyable.
You can play John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen both from desktop computers and mobile devices in various online casinos, betting from €0.20 up to €125 per spin.
Finally, the Egyptian-inspired soundtrack and well-crafted graphics will make for an enjoyable gaming experience!

Compatibility and Betting Range

Players can enjoy John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen from desktop computers and mobile devices in various online casinos. The game accepts bets ranging from €0.25 to €125 per spin. Players can select their preferred bet amount and start spinning the reels. The game is designed to suit both low-budget players and high rollers.

Maximum Win

The maximum win in John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen is x10,500 times the bet. While it is not as high as the first release of the John Hunter series, it is still a significant win that can potentially reward the lucky players. To achieve a maximum win, players need to land Cleopatra Wild and fill the reels with multipliers during the free spins mode.

Review: John Hunter Tomb of the Scarab Queen
General information
Software: Pragmatic Play
Reels: 5
Paylines: 25
Minimum bet amount: €0.25
Maximum bet amount: €125
Maximum win: x10,500 times the bet
Return to Player (RTP): 96.5%
Volatility: medium
Main features
John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen is the title of the third slot from developer Pragmatic Play, which tells the story of the greedy explorer John Hunter as he travels the world seeking to appropriate riches and various treasures.
The figure of the treasure-seeking explorer is not new: before Pragmatic, Play'n Go created the character of Rich Wilde, and Novomatic created the Book of Dead series.
With the first release of the John Hunter saga, called Da Vinci's Treasure, Pragmatic Play caused a stir by advertising a stratospheric win equal to 48,000 times the bet, a win that no one, of course, ever came close to! There were also controversies over the second slot in the series, Aztec Treasure, when it was revealed that the slot was not entirely original but was a kind of mix between the classic Interactive Montezuma's Treasure and a kind of homemade prototype on the Megaways engine.
As for this latest chapter in the series, explorer John Hunter finds himself no less than among the pyramids of Giza: the game features 5 reels and 25 paylines and is enriched by the possibility of obtaining various free spins and multipliers up to x25.
Symbols, Wilds and Scatters
The background of John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen is a desert environment with the great pyramids flanking the reels, and even the symbols with the highest value are themed to Ancient Egypt like the Book of Ra slot. Among these, as far as regular symbols are concerned, we find a leather bag, a gun in a holster, the explorer John Hunter, and the deity Anobi. Queen Cleopatra is the Wild of this slot machine and can replace all other symbols, except the Scatter, to achieve a winning combination. The Scatter is instead represented by the majestic pyramid and allows access to free spins, where you can also take advantage of various multipliers.
In addition to the themed symbols, we also find the cards from the J to the Ace.
John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen: conclusions
Of the three slot machines in the Hunter explorer saga, this is the most successful: it is first and foremost an original slot, the jackpot is high but not entirely improbable like that of the first chapter in the series, and the linear gameplay is enriched with special features that make the game quite enjoyable.
You can play John Hunter and the Tomb of the Scarab Queen both from desktop computers and mobile devices in various online casinos, betting from €0.20 up to €125 per spin.
Finally, the Egyptian-inspired soundtrack and well-crafted graphics will make for an enjoyable gaming experience!
